p: The tested compounds 18b, 19a, and 20a exhibited higher binding affinities (ΔG b = −9.81 to −10.40 kcal/mol) towards CDK-9 compared to the native ligand, CAN508 (ΔG b = −6.29 kcal/mol). The high affinities of the new compounds could be attributed to their bulkier size compared to CAN508 which allow them to occupy larger volume of the active site in CDK-9.
